line_1: No nodding crest the crouching infant frights,
line_2: No clarion rudely breaks the bride's delights;
Infests his dream, or wakes his nights.

line_1: Whose terror-striking frown the school-boy frights
line_2: Ye silent, solemn, strong, stupendous heights,

line_1: I soon recover from these needless frights,
line_2: And God is merciful — sets all to rights.

line_1: Looks pleas'd, but full of fears and frights.
line_2: Tom stops, and Cloe soon alights,
